result.execSummary:
The defendant Roberta J Skippon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs on each count.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment as directed by Dept. of Corrections.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. No contact with anyone associated with possession, use or sale of illegal drugs.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Be honest in debriefing with law enforcement regarding her drug activity.  Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 18 months upon successful completion of all conditions of probation and with recommendation from Dept. of Corrections. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

timeConds.notes: 30 DAYS STAYED.  To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. Huber release granted. 60 days to report to serve the 10 day sentence.
To perform 20 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.

records.addlTxt: from defendant asking court to remove the job seach order as part of her conviction and to lift the no contact with co-defendant. Court responds - full-time employment up to DOC - I didn't order a no-contact. DTE

Defendant Roberta J Skippon in court with attorney Kevin D. Musolf.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.   Minute sheet. State amends Ct. 1 to Misd. Possession of THC, gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to amended Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 as charged.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of amended Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 as charged. Court dismisses Ct. 3 but reads in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains as is.

Defendant Roberta J Skippon in court with attorney Kevin D. Musolf.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Petition and proposed order to unseal a warrant authorizing the installation, monitoring, maintenance, and retrieval of a GPS tracking device
Return of Officer, Acknowledgment of Return of Officer
Warrant authorizing the installation, monitoring, maintenance, and retrieval of a GPS tracking device and affidavit

Defendant Roberta J Skippon in court with attorney Kevin D. Musolf.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Set for prelim.  Bond remains in effect.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Roberta J Skippon in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel,. right to preliminary hearing. Defendant request time to retain an atty. Bond set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.
